review_text:
We rented the cabin for my daughterâ€™s wedding. It allowed us to have the whole family in one spot. The house was beautiful, equipped with everything we needed for the weekend plus more. Judy allowed us to check in at 2:00 pm instead of the normal time of 4:00 so that we could start decorating and getting ready for the wedding at the pavilion. On the wedding night we had two guests that had a long drive home and since we only had 8 people in our house Judy allowed us to have let the other two guests stay with no extra charge. She was prompt in answering anytime we needed her and check in and check out was a breeze.
My one and only complaint was that we did find a packet of birth control pills under the pillow in one of the rooms, and some small empty liquor bottles in the couch arm rest of another.
Overall it was a great stay, just thought the cleaning person couldâ€™ve been a bit more thorough.

review_text: There is only one word to describe this heavenly place - Perfect! Everything was just perfect! Exactly what I needed for a little down time and personal R & R. I arrived in the evening to a chorus of big and little frogs from the lake, whip-poor-will calls, and a beautiful moon to greet me in an otherwise silent forest evening. The cabin is simply magnificent. The photos don't, and couldn't possibly do it justice. I was fortunate enough to meet the hosts, Jim and Judy, and told them that if there had been any way for me to beam the place over to my farm in Illinois, they would have been left with an empty foundation! I loved the place that much! Since I was traveling alone, I didn't even begin to take advantage of all that the cabin and the property have to offer for a larger group - especially for folks who like to cook. That kitchen is astounding! And Judy and Jim are two of the most wonderful people and accommodating hosts that you will ever meet. Don't hesitate to book your stay or event with them at The Village. You will be ever so glad that you did!

Everything about the AirBnb was excellent. It is located in a lovely neighborhood on the outskirts of Rolla, conveniently located near a grocery store, restaurants and other shops. The AirBnb is a spacious duplex that has a great floor plan including 2 bedrooms, 2 updated bathrooms, an updated kitchen, dining area, living area, laundry room and 1 car attached garage. It is modern, tastefully decorated, and clean.
Communication with both the AirBnb website and Shane was excellent. Checkin and checkout procedures were easy to follow. We messaged Shane twice about TV programming and heard back from him within a minute.
All of this and the price was reasonable. I would definitely recommend this AirBnb.

review_text: we stayed here while visiting friends in Steelville. It was a convenient location and the drive between the two cities is lovely. we pretty much just used the beds and bathrooms but the kitchen does seem to be pretty well stocked with pans and baking trays/ dishes, coffee maker &pods with creamers, waters in fridge, and a nice selection of glasses and dishes for our use. There is also a blender a hand mixer and a toaster :-) the beds were comfortable and the house is Charming. Great water pressure in the shower! super easy to access the house with an exterior lock box and quiet Street. it does share a wall but we did not hear the neighbors. we did not use the garage but it looks like you might be able to use it if the weather was inclement. also did not use the back deck or grill but it is an awesome feature! I also really like that they provided several throw blankets for curling up and watching TV and that we had two pillows per person that is a definite put this house on my favorite list! thanks for having your house on Airbnb!

review_text: Absolutely terrible experience at this place! The house looks super cute in photos, but it wasnâ€™t a very clean place. There were dead bugs, TONS of cobwebs in the basement where the washer and dryer are, you walk face first into them trying to do laundry. The washer smelled of mildew and musky. My daughter was grossed out by dried food on the utensils and we had to go buy a brillo pad to scrub down a pan with burnt food on it. The house was hot, I had to turn the air way down to 66 just to cool it down so I could sleep. Youâ€™d set it and it would turn itself back up to 75. We all woke up hot and kept having to change the thermostat. This happened the entire stay. I wasnâ€™t going to write a review at all, until I got a $500 request for damages that we didnâ€™t create. There was a lamp in one of the bedrooms that never worked and at the end of our stay when we stripped the sheets, I bumped the lamp with my leg and the whole shade and lightbulb fell off. When I looked at it, I could see wires hanging out and could see where a gray putty had been used to repair the bulb. When I was sent photos of the lamp and lightbulb, you could see the putty so thereâ€™s my proof of it being previously damaged. I actually had to unscrew the entire lamp to get everything to go back together. I did not break the lamp, and it definitely wasnâ€™t worth $200 that I was accused of. I was also accused of knocking a hole in the wall which did not happen, and was requested $300 to patch a tiny little hole that you could fix with some $5 spackling and a coat of paint. Absolutely ridiculous experience and Iâ€™d never return!

It's usually pretty silent back there, so we were surprised when the house next door was loudly torn down from 5-8 am on a Saturday morning. Contacted Shane who had idea that was happening, who apologized profusely and said he would find out what's going on, but don't think we heard back. Thankfully it was pretty well done after that. Only other thing to mention was I don't know what's going on with that wonderful huge bathtub, but it looks like someone tried to patch it with a moldy green towel. I mean we could shower, but I love taking a bath in that big tub and I just couldn't with that rough nasty looking thing. Hopefully they fix it better soon. Needless to say, we've booked it again for St. Pat's when we'll be back!

review_text: Very cute recently redone home, well done and tasteful remodel with a spacious and comfortable layout. Close proximity to the interstate made it an easy to find, it is listed as North Park street on online directions and that is correct. Loved the large washer and dryer for catching up on vacation laundry and the outdoor deck was so cute and nice to relax on a warm spring night. Kitchen was gorgeous and so fun to cook in all items available and thoughtful snacks like microwave popcorn and water, perfect for a kids movie night and great streaming services for watching shows. Bathroom was spa like with tons of nice fluffy towels and the bedrooms were spacious with comfortable beds and luxurious bedding. Loved the lit battery operated candles all over such a nice touch! Would stay again and recommend to others, thanks for the great stay Shane!

review_text: Mossman Cottage is utterly enchanting. It sits at the end of a quiet street in the midst of a large shaded yard bordering a quiet field where does and their fawns silently meander out of the woods and bird song fills the air. Amy and Barbara have put a lot of thought into their guestsâ€™ comfort from the throws and recliners in the living room and a large closet in the main living space where one can easily store things out of sight, to plenty of linens in the large bathroom, to extra blankets and fans in the bedrooms, and plenty of dishes in the kitchen. They were prompt with replies to all of my questions and check-in was very easy. Everything felt welcoming and homey. While the step up and down between rooms and the steep stairs to the adorable second bedroom under the eaves arenâ€™t for those with mobility challenges, it does add to the cottageâ€™s charm, and I wholeheartedly recommend this stay to absolutely everyone else.

Mossman Cottage was great. The lockbox was a bit of a challenge - Amy's directions were exactly right but we needed to take a closer look at the box to find out that just the combination plate and not more of the box released
The cottage was very comfortable-- the quiet location and front porch for watching the deer were just as pictured. We also appreciated the TV and wi-fi connection option when we felt the need to reconnect for a bit. The choice for air conditiioning or open windows was perfect for the time we were there.
We did not use the 2nd floor bedroom (although I did have to at least check it out just because it was there). The single steps to access the kitchen from either the main room and bedroom were not a problem at all and added to the charm. We would definitely consider returning if we are in the area.
Thanks, Amy, for everything.

Would definitely stay again.

review_text: GLITZ AND GLAM!!!!!! The Blacksmith Bungalow is a whole lot of Beverly and a touch of Hillbilly. Inside, it's very spacious, super-duper modern, gorgeous, and extremely fancy. It's chock-full of cool games and the Roku TV has tons of entertainment options, plus the internet is exceptionally fast... For the most part, it makes up for the near-total lack of cell service. It was beyond clean and the bedding was possibly the most comfortable I've ever experienced *anywhere*, no joke! The Village is a very peaceful, secluded location and shockingly close to the billion or so amenities available in lovely Rolla. The gravel roads are a bit rough but a standard car can handle it if you drive with care. PLEASE do know that it is NOT lit at night and VERY hard to navigate in the dark; in daylight, the signs are handy. I forgot my fishing pole, but the pond would've been an awesome place to fish if I had brought it. Would recommend for a quiet, beautiful stay!

The Blacksmith cottage is 100% up to date with sparkly clean appliances, a well-equipped kitchen, comfortable furniture and beds. and little touches - hot cocoa mix, biscotti, and popcorn provided for guests. It has everything you expect in 2023 with the rustic look of the 1800's. Judy was an absolutely fantastic host and was extremely communicative. We absolutely loved our stay, and hope that it will be available for future visits.

name: Teri
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
November 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Pictures do not do this rental or property justice!! The location is about 5/10 minutes from downtown Rolla - Judy provides detailed instructions on driving into the location, as it is a sharp right at the bottom of a hill. Be careful - there are a couple HUGE potholes as you turn in. You will drive through the entire property to get to the rental - it is so cute, a wedding would be beautiful here. Make sure you take some time to walk around and check things out. There is ample parking and even doggie doo bags on the shed next door! Cute porch. Inside, everything was SO clean. Cute living area with fireplace, very well stocked kitchen, even Disney+ for the TV! Very nice laundry area, well-appointed bathrooms and bedrooms. Comfy beds with lots of bedding/comforters/blankets - everything you could want if you are someone that is cold all the time like me :) I wish we were staying a whole week, not just a quick weekend. The only negative at all is that the 'master' bathroom shower - the way the door opens, you have to get a little wet to turn the shower on. And the showerhead is nice, but lacking pressure, so ladies with long hair, it will take you a while. If those are the worst parts about this place though, you know you found a good one! There was even Kleenex, which has been unheard of in Airbnbs I've stayed in (it's the little things, I tell ya). Can't wait to come back for a slightly longer stay next year!!

review_text: This is one of the best properties we've ever stayed at -- pastoral, woodsy but minutes from town, fun, quaint, and well-maintained. The beds were luxurious, the house well-appointed, and the host, Judy, friendly, helpful, and respectful of our privacy. We were in town to celebrate my father's 90th birthday with family from all over the country, and when we showed them pictures of where we were staying, they were jealous. Next time, one of them is going to snap it up before we get a chance to book. Don't miss your chance. If you're looking for accommodations in the Rolla area, the Bunkhouse Bungalow is where you want to stay.

review_text: Peace and quiet and a quality home make for a special stay. Very easy check-in with all the amenities - and more - of home. The swing was my porch favorite. Inside, the home is spacious. It easily accommodates the family and there is room to spread out inside, and then open the front door and you have all the outside space. The one twin bed has a trundle. The washer & dryer are new and modern. The refrigerator is roomy. Hard floors throughout. The beds and couch were comfortable. Kitchen table seats 8. Simple instructions make your stay easy. It is tucked away off a winding road with the town of Rolla accessible in about 15 minutes. Wish we had had more downtime to simply be in the house! A+ accommodations and host!

Stayed one night
review_text:
What an unexpected gem in the heart of Missouri! Rolla was the best place for us to stop on a long roadtrip after a 12-hour day of driving, and we could not have been happier with our decision to stay here! The directions were clear so we had no problem finding it, and we were in for a treat! The old Western Town vibe was amazing, and the Blacksmith was beyond our expectations. Sparkling clean - seriously, I can't even describe how clean the place was - and so beautifully decorated. Our pup loved the concrete floors - he ran laps down the hallway and around the kitchen table (gleeful to not be in the car anymore!) - and we humans loved the comfortable couch, fireplace and omg the amenities! Shower...excellent. Washer/Dryer...so convenient. Beds? Dreamland.
We cannot recommend this stay highly enough. BOOK IT!

review_text: My family and I came down to explore the area and meet up with my sister, who lives in Springfield, MO. We chose this place because of its themed charm and wooded location. The property is absolutely gorgeous. The little village scene is picturesque and gave my three kids plenty of ideas for their imaginations to play with. The house was beautiful, exactly how I would want my dream home to look. We had plenty of room for 6 people and had every "home away from home" amenity that we would ever need. The house was clean and well-cared for. We could have stayed there forever if could! Thank you Judy and Jim for being so hospitable and kind to my family. We felt right at home. We are already planning another trip down and will be staying at the Blacksmith's Shop.
